description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bkhge","text":"The reference sequence of structurally complex regions can only be obtained through a highly accurate clone-based approach that we call Single-Haplotype Iterative Mapping and Sequencing (SHIMS). In recent years, improvements to SHIMS have reduced the cost and time required by two orders of magnitude, but internally repetitive clones still require extensive manual effort to transform draft assemblies into reference-quality finished sequences. Here we describe SHIMS 3.0, using ultra-long nanopore reads to augment the Illumina data from SHIMS 2.0 assemblies and resolve internally repetitive structures. This greatly minimizes the need for manual finishing of Illumina-based draft assemblies, allowing a small team with no prior finishing experience to sequence challenging targets with high accuracy. This protocol proceeds from clone-picking to finished assemblies in 2 weeks for about 80 dollars per clone. We recently used this protocol to produce reference sequence of structurally complex palindromes on chimpanzee and rhesus macaque X chromosomes. Our protocol provides access to structurally complex regions that would otherwise be inaccessible from whole-genome shotgun data or require an impractical amount of manual effort to generate an accurate assembly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":540,"length":9}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"74DC2B527A1611EC96AB0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2018.019"}}}}

Each clone typically receives 1-5% of the total reads. Occasionally some clones will have no reads; this usually indicates that the culture of the clone (Steps 1-3) has failed (see troubleshooting information for Step 55).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bhauo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"17tuj","text":"Expect to obtain 3-10 full-length reads per clone. Because of the high rate of insertions and deletions in individual nanopore reads, full-length reads may differ in length by 10 kb or more. Occasionally, a clone will have no reads that start and end in vector sequence, but the clone length will be apparent from a peak in the tail of the distribution of read lengths. It may still be possible to reconstruct a full-length consensus sequence by rotating one of these putative full-length reads to place the vector sequence at the beginning. However, we do not recommend this procedure for internally repetitive clones, particularly tandem arrays. {"blocks":[{"key":"9uarf","text":"Polish the longest read twice, using the other full-length nanopore reads:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2lbtl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"329ut","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"2iojd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1hlpd","text":"minimap2 -x map-ont clone_name.longest.fl.fa clone_name.fl.fq \u003eclone_name.longest.fl.paf","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2258j","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3vfbg","text":"racon clone_name.fl.fq clone_name.longest.fl.paf clone_name.longest.fl.fa \u003eclone_name.longest.fl.racon.fa","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b5a40","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5ptbd","text":"minimap2 -x map-ont clone_name.longest.fl.racon.1.fa clone_name.fl.fq \u003eclone_name.longest.fl.racon.paf","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1fode","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"85p9t","text":"racon clone_name.fl.fq clone_name.longest.fl.racon.1.paf clone_name.longest.fl.racon.1.fa \u003eclone_name.fl.consensus.fa","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e8r27","text":"Align reads one last time to generate SAM format alignments suitable for assembly editors.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5tqda","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1paes","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"cajjq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f1pc3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4ghg6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"9vul8","text":"CRITICAL STEP","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"473bp","text":"The BAM file format cannot accommodate CIGAR strings with greater than 65535 operations. Alignments involving nanopore reads spanning the full length of a BAC clone will exceed this limit. We strongly recommend storing alignments in SAM or CRAM format to avoid the loss of detailed alignment information.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c5ib5","text":"minimap2 -x asm20 -a -L --sam-hit-only -R '@RG\\tID:S\\tSM:S\\tPL:ILLUMINA' clone_name.polish.5.fa clone_name.illumina.single.fq | samtools sort -O SAM - \u003eclone_name.single.sorted.sam","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"beui7","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aej6c","text":"minimap2 -x sr -a -L --sam-hit-only -R '@RG\\tID:FR\\tSM:FR\\tPL:ILLUMINA' clone_name.polish.5.fa clone_name.illumina.forward.fq clone_name.illumina.reverse.fq | samtools sort -O SAM - \u003eclone_name.paired.sorted.sam","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ch39p","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8dlt8","text":"minimap2 -x map-pb -a -L --sam-hit-only -R '@RG\\tID:P\\tSM:P\\tPL:PACBIO' clone_name.polish.5.fa clone_name.pacbio.fq | samtools sort -O SAM - \u003eclone_name.pacbio.sorted.sam","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e6gcc","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8v3if","text":"minimap2 -x map-ont -a -L --sam-hit-only -R '@RG\\tID:N\\tSM:N\\tPL:PACBIO' clone_name.polish.5.fa clone_name.nanopore.fq | samtools sort -O SAM - \u003eclone_name.nanopore.sorted.sam","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"371i1","text":"Combine alignments","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aht3d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ftkrt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"f0ddb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8pk3m","text":"samtools merge -f clone_name.allreads.sorted.sam clone_name.single.sorted.sam clone_name.paired.sorted.sam clone_name.pacbio.sorted.sam clone_name.nanopore.sorted.sam","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5h4ck","text":"Generate database for Gap5","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d42mg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a1fm6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ak1b9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cr8fu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"79kp8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"677c0","text":"CRITICAL STEP","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":54,"offset":427}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4o3je","text":"We now recommend Gap5 over Consed, because Gap5 natively supports loading data directly from SAM files and displaying full-length nanopore reads. It is possible to split SAM alignments of full-length nanopore reads into smaller fragments that can be encoded in a BAM file and displayed by Consed without loss of information. For those who wish to use Consed, we implement this work-around in a custom Perl script (available at https://github.com/dwbellott/shims3_assembly_pipeline/).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"00661953732911EC86550A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/dwbellott/shims3_assembly_pipeline"},"mutability":"","type":"link"}}}},"1":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8qgv2","text":"tg_index -o clone_name.g5d -p -9 -s clone_name.allreads.sorted.sam","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2mu8d","text":"Open the assembly in Gap5:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2vbbb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dhmjt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3u20i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6k1li","text":"gap5 clone_name.g5d","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9v04k","text":"Select ‘Edit Contig’ from the ‘Edit’ menu.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1vmc1","text":"Resolve discrepancies between Illumina reads and full-length nanopore reads (Fig. 2).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1ihsg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"u6ve","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"are92","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1gl0q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ejpej","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"58kv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"71gvb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"eln60","text":"CRITICAL STEP","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"582bt","text":"In Gap5, it is not possible to directly edit the consensus sequence. Instead, indicate which readings are authoritative by marking bases as high quality with the ‘]’ key, and the consensus will automatically update.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"a91gd","text":"CRITICAL STEP","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":7,"offset":233,"style":"bold"}],"key":"3am17","text":"We usually resolve the consensus in favor of the Illumina reads. The vast majority of discrepancies between these technologies occur at homopolymer repeats, where nanopore reads are especially prone to insertion and deletion errors (Fig. 2a). More rarely, we encounter systematic errors in nanopore base calling that generate a consensus that is not supported by any Illumina read.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"bdivs","text":"CRITICAL STEP","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6jm1f","text":"We resolve disagreements among Illumina reads in favor of the consensus of full-length nanopore reads. In clones that contain duplicated sequences, short Illumina reads can be mapped to the wrong repeat unit, but full-length nanopore reads are not subject to this artifact, and will usually have the correct base at each SFV.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5d4ff","text":"Resolve SSRs by realigning reads around the SSR region. Select reads by clicking on their names on the left hand side of the edit window, and choose ‘Realign Selection’ from the ‘Command’ menu.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1it3c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a4qk0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3q5hb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"dnrp9","text":"CRITICAL STEP","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e4f11","text":"Stutter noise from replication slippage in SSRs causes divergent reads and low-quality base calls. In some cases, unambiguous resolution of these repeats may not be possible, and they should be annotated as unresolved in Step 71.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9n5rn","text":"Remove any vector-sequence contamination at the ends of the clone. In the Gap5 edit window, use the ‘Search’ button to search the consensus sequence for the sequences at the cloning site of your vector. Trim away the vector sequence outside of the restriction sites used to generate your clone library (usually EcoRI, BamHI, or MboI).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
